title: Multiple Sclerosis Treatment Guidelines
content: Multiple sclerosis management aims to modify disease course, treat relapses, and manage symptoms. Disease-modifying therapies reduce relapse rates and MRI activity and are selected based on disease activity and risk tolerance. Acute relapses are treated with high-dose corticosteroids. Symptomatic management addresses fatigue, spasticity, pain, bladder dysfunction, and other manifestations affecting quality of life.
